lead_paragraph: In a sweeping directive, President Obama pressed forward in the face of lingering opposition in Congress to repealing the Cold War trade embargo.

headline.print_headline: Obama Moves to Further Ease Cuba Embargo
headline.main: Obama, Cementing New Ties With Cuba, Lifts Limits on Cigars and Rum

snippet: In a sweeping directive, President Obama pressed forward in the face of lingering opposition in Congress to repealing the Cold War trade embargo....
abstract: Pres Obama attempts to solidify his administration's historic restoration of ties with Cuba by issuing directive to lift Cold War trade embargo and end 50 years of secret plotting against Cuba's government; loosening of sanctions includes lifting of $100 limit on bringing Cuban cigars and rum into United States.
